snippet: A pilot project under review on privately held land in Wyoming is part of a new chapter in a strange and tangled tale that helped define the West.
abstract: Jana and Rich Wilson hope to be approved by the Bureau of Land Management for pilot project to shelter a herd of 250 wild horses on their 4,700-acre Deerwood Ranch in Wyoming.
lead_paragraph: A pilot project under review on privately held land in Wyoming is part of a new chapter in a strange and tangled tale that helped define the West.

headline.seo: ‘Ecosanctuary’ Plans for Wild Horses Add Tourism to the Mix
headline.main: ‘Ecosanctuary’ Plans for Wild Horses Add Tourism to the Mix
headline.print_headline: ‘Ecosanctuary’ Plans for Wild Horses Add Tourism to the Mix
